alert.note: Alert for Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 22 at 4:11AM PDT until October 23 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches above 4500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph through late morning. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. * WHEN...Until 2 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially along Highway 204 above 4500 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The first significant Pacific storm of fall will bring wet snow to the northern Blue Mountains, heaviest accumulations above 4500 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.
